geneVariantDescriptions.description: OSBPL1A-BRAF results from the fusion of OSBPL1A and BRAF (PMID: 28634282), and has not been biochemically characterized, however, due to the effects of other BRAF fusions that result in loss of the BRAF CR1 domain and retention of the protein kinase domain (PMID: 23890088, PMID: 12781369), is predicted to result in a gain of function. OSBPL1A-BRAF has been identified in tall cell variant thyroid papillary carcinoma (PMID: 28634282).

references.title: Raf proteins and cancer: B-Raf is identified as a mutational target.
Genomic Alterations in Fatal Forms of Non-Anaplastic Thyroid Cancer: Identification of MED12 and RBM10 as Novel Thyroid Cancer Genes Associated with Tumor Virulence.
Recurrent BRAF kinase fusions in melanocytic tumors offer an opportunity for targeted therapy.
